channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: President Trump set to hold the spotlight at Davos as international tension rises
item.description: President Trump is expected to speak at the World Economic Forum this week, following a buildup of international tension.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is expected to speak at the World Economic Forum this week, following a buildup of international tension.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Ex-Trump official weighs in on whether the presidency is operating without guardrails
item.description: With troops standing by for Minnesota and an escalating campaign for Greenland, NPR's Michel Martin asks former Trump official Miles Taylor if this is a presidency without guardrails.
item.content:encoded: With troops standing by for Minnesota and an escalating campaign for Greenland, NPR's Michel Martin asks former Trump official Miles Taylor if this is a presidency without guardrails.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: China's birth rate fell to a record low last year despite attempts to boost it
item.description: Despite government efforts to boost fertility, China's birth rate fell to a record low in 2025.
item.content:encoded: Despite government efforts to boost fertility, China's birth rate fell to a record low in 2025.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Less personnel drama but still sky-high turnover one year into Trump's new term
item.description: A large share of the departures so far this term were on the National Security Council staff.
item.content:encoded:
A large share of the departures so far this term were on the National Security Council staff.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Gretchen Whitmer says it's not 'paranoia' to fear Trump disrupting elections
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer about tariffs, the security of upcoming elections and the prospects of a female president.
item.content:encoded:
Morning Edition.'/>

NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer about tariffs, the security of upcoming elections and the prospects of a female president.

(Image credit: NPR)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Wall Street-backed landlords a target for both Trump and Democrats
item.description: Like President Trump, lawmakers around the U.S. blame corporate homebuyers for high prices and want to restrict them. Experts say it's not so simple, and passing laws has proved difficult.
item.content:encoded:
Like President Trump, lawmakers around the U.S. blame corporate homebuyers for high prices and want to restrict them. Experts say it's not so simple, and passing laws has proved difficult.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump to speak at the World Economic Forum amid rising international tension, Concerns about conditions at Texas detention center grow after 3 deaths, Indiana wins first national football title.
item.content:encoded: Trump to speak at the World Economic Forum amid rising international tension, Concerns about conditions at Texas detention center grow after 3 deaths, Indiana wins first national football title.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Ohio lawmakers want to try new approach to get Ten Commandments in schools
item.description: Three states that tried to put the Ten Commandments in schools have been blocked in the courts. In Ohio, lawmakers are considering a new approach.
item.content:encoded: Three states that tried to put the Ten Commandments in schools have been blocked in the courts. In Ohio, lawmakers are considering a new approach.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Donaldson

item.title: Trump supporters share confusion and anger over the president's focus on Greenland
item.description: Some of President Trump's loyal supporters say they're confused and dismayed by the president's aggressive posture toward Denmark and America's European allies.
item.content:encoded: Some of President Trump's loyal supporters say they're confused and dismayed by the president's aggressive posture toward Denmark and America's European allies.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Stars and Stripes top editor talks about Pentagon's takeover of the newspaper
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Stars and Stripes editor-in-chief Erik Slavin about the Pentagon's takeover of the newspaper that has covered U.S. armed forces since the Civil War.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin asks Stars and Stripes editor-in-chief Erik Slavin about the Pentagon's takeover of the newspaper that has covered U.S. armed forces since the Civil War.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin
